position.marginalia_text:
The king mie grandfather, by his adulterie, bred the wrack of his lawfull dawghter & heire; in begetting that Bastard, who unnaturally rebelled, & procured the ruine of his owne Soueraine & sister. And what good her posteritie hath gotten sen-sine, of sum of that vnlawfull generation, Bothwell his treacherous attempts can beare witnes. The king of Scotts in his new manuscript Instructions to his sonne Henrie.
Next the Lawes, I woold haue you to be well versed in authentick Histories, & in the chronicles of all nations; but specially in owr owne Histories (ne sis peregrinus domi) the example wherof most neerl concernes you. I meane not of such infamous Invei[n]tiues, as Buchanans, or Knoxes Chronicles: & if anie of theise infamous Libels remaine vntil your dayes, vse the Lawe vpon the keepers therof. Ibidem.

book.title: The History of the Reformation in Scotland
